'''Pope Shenouda III''' of Alexandria ([[Coptic language|Coptic]]: {{Coptic|â² â²â²¡â² â²â²â²â² Ï¢â²â²â²â²©Ï¯ â²¡â²â²â²Ï© Ï£â²â²©â²â²§}}) (born '''Nazeer Gayed''' on 3 August 1923) is the 117th [[Pope of the Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria|Pope of Alexandria and the Patriarch of All Africa on the Holy Apostolic See of Saint Mark the Evangelist]] of the [[Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria]]. '''Pope Shenouda III''' of Alexandria ([[Coptic language|Coptic]]: {{Coptic|â² â²â²¡â² â²â²â²â² Ï¢â²â²â²â²©Ï¯ â²¡â²â²â²Ï© Ï£â²â²©â²â²§}}) ([[Arabic language|Arabic]]: {{lang-ar|'''Ø¨Ø§Ø¨Ø§ Ø§ÙØ¥Ø³ÙÙØ¯Ø±ÙØ©''' Ø´ÙÙØ¯Ø© Ø§ÙØ«Ø§ÙØ«}}) (born '''Nazeer Gayed''' on 3 August 1923) is the 117th [[Pope of the Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria|Pope of Alexandria and the Patriarch of All Africa on the Holy Apostolic See of Saint Mark the Evangelist]] of the [[Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria]]. He is the head of [[The Holy Synod of the Coptic Orthodox Patriarchate of Alexandria]].
A graduate of [[Cairo University]] and the Coptic Orthodox Seminary, Nazeer Gayed became a monk under the name ''Fr. Antonios the Syrian'' after joining the [[Syrian Monastery]] of the [[Virgin Mary|Ever-Virgin Mary]] the [[Theotokos]], where he was later elevated to the [[priesthood]].
A graduate of [[Cairo University]] and the Coptic Orthodox Seminary, Nazeer Gayed became a monk under the name ''Fr. Antonios the Syrian'' after joining the [[Syrian Monastery]] of the [[Virgin Mary|Ever-Virgin Mary]] the [[Theotokos]], where he was later elevated to the [[priesthood]].
